channel.title: The Pirate Bay news UPDATED
channel.description:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8003799.stm
A court in Sweden has jailed four men behind The Pirate Bay (TPB), the world's most high-profile file-sharing website. Frederik Neij, Gottfrid Svartholm Warg, Carl Lundstrom and Peter Sunde were found guilty of breaking copyright law and were sentenced to a year in jail. The Pirate Bay is the world's most high profile file-sharing website and was set up in 2003 by anti-copyright organisation Piratbyran, but for the last five years it has been run by individuals. Millions of files are exchanged using the service every day. No copyright content is hosted on The Pirate Bay's web servers; instead the site hosts "torrent" links to TV, film and music files held on its users' computers.
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8002938.stm http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/7892073.stm

item.title: The Pirate Bay news UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:16, topic:262505”]The Dutch version of the copyright watchdog is taking it to the boundaries. Companies now have to pay rights to have the radio on.
An example: If a barber has a radio in his shop, the barber is using the radio for business purposes (even if it’s for his own pleasure). So the barber has to pay. So the fuck faces get money from the radio station, and from the listeners. That’s like Shell asking money from companies because they use petrol in their cars.[/quote]
Greedy capitalist bastards

Read full topic

item.title: The Pirate Bay news UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:16, topic:262505”]The Dutch version of the copyright watchdog is taking it to the boundaries. Companies now have to pay rights to have the radio on.
An example: If a barber has a radio in his shop, the barber is using the radio for business purposes (even if it’s for his own pleasure). So the barber has to pay. So the fuck faces get money from the radio station, and from the listeners. That’s like Shell asking money from companies because they use petrol in their cars.[/quote]
Agree with you, if you don’t use the music directly to earn money they should not pay for it.
But its more like shell (Shell sucks anyway, StatoilHydro is better) asking for money if a company gives out free gas bought from them.

Copyrights should only last until 10 and 20 years after the product is made.

Read full topic

item.title: The Pirate Bay news UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Lothy:

It’ll be very dangerous if the Pirate Bay loses the case, because it will set a new precedent making it very easy to take any other torrent sites down within Sweden.

Its sad if Peter Sunde and the 3 other lose, but that will not affect TPB (Except if they must in prison, but that will not happen and if that happen someone else will take over in that period.), and TPB’s servers are not anymore in Sweden.
The FRA law and IPRED make its harder for swedish Torrent sides so no point being in Sweden anymore.

I’m lad its hard to punish someone for downloading copyrighted materials in Norway.

Read full topic

item.title: The Pirate Bay news UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:12, topic:262505”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=346654.msg2715020#msg2715020 date=1237584583]
Does anyone find it funny that people waste so much money and political influence to enforce the Digital Millennium Copyright Act when they could be helping children who are being abused (or some other worthy cause)?
[/quote]
These capitalist bastards aren’t happy unless they’re making record profits… and everyone else is suffering, so that it makes their wealth seem greater.[/quote]
I’m all for Capitalism, it’s a great thing in the hands of the responsible. It does corrupt many, though.

Read full topic

If TPB is taken down, it will only be replaced with another site, or another method.
[I hate greedy capitalists]
[/quote]

So if they lose in court The Pirate Bay will still live.[/quote]
Oh, I see.

Trials over, http://www.vnunet.com/vnunet/news/2237844/pirate-bay-trial-comes, results are supposed to be coming April.
